biospec_descr.textblock: plasma, serum, white cells, placenta tissue

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to find the incidence of mental disorders during different
      periods of pregnancy and its associated factors and  consequences.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence ， Associated Factors and Influences of Prenatal Mental Disorders
clinical_study.condition: Mental Disorder During Pregnancy - Baby Not Yet Delivered

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Aged at least 18 years of age

          -  8 to 12 weeks of pregnancy

          -  There is no history of mental illness

          -  Had perinatal health care in a Women's & Children's Health Hospital

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  The obvious body disease

          -  Having anxiety, phobia, hypochondriasis, obsessive-compulsive disorder or
             depression before pregnancy

          -  Having severe complications during pregnancy

          -  Fetal malformation or abortion

          -  Can't understand the questionnaire

          -  Without informed consent

          -  More than  13 weeks of pregnancy

          -  Less than 18 years of age

study_pop.textblock:
Pregnant women who had perinatal health care in a Women's & Children's Health Hospital of
        zhejiang province, China

primary_outcome.description: We would like to find the incidence of mental disorders in early (8-12 weeks),middle (18-22 weeks) and later(32 weeks to delivery) period of pregnancy
primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of mental disorders during different periods of pregnancy
primary_outcome.time_frame: from 8 weeks of pregnancy to delivery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: We would like to explore which period of mental disorders had the most significant infuences on pregnancy outcomes including obstetrical complications(e.g.gestational diabetes mellitus(GDM),hypertensive disorder complicating pregnancy(HDCP)),outcome of fetus(e.g.preterm,low birth weight and fetal anomaly) and health of infant and puerpera.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from 8 weeks of pregnancy to 6 months after delivery

clinical_study.source: Zhejiang Provincial Natural Science Foundation of China

lead_sponsor.agency: Zhejiang Provincial Natural Science Foundation of China

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
